description.narrative: The main developmental impact of the project is expected to be in the developing member countries in the MENA region where AUB plans to expand as follows: Improving the quality and operational standards of the local banks acquired/to be acquired by the Bank. Strengthening the financial systems in the local markets where AUB is/will operate through introducing new talent, modern management, best practices and comprehensive risk management frameworks. It would also increase competition, resulting in the provision of better financial services and banking products. Strengthening the capital base of the banks acquired/to be acquired that will lead to enhancing the access to finance in the underdeveloped markets in the Region and as such contribute to economic growth, capital formation, employment and private sector development. Developing the retail lending and housing finance capabilities of the banks acquired/to be acquired, which would benefit the underserved consumer segments. Supporting the flow of funds from the resource surplus GCC countries to the less developed markets and facilitate trade, investment, remittances, etc and thus increase regional economic integration.

The proposed project involves an equity and sub-debt investment in Ahli United Bank B.S.C (AUB or the Bank). AUB is a regional commercial banking group providing conventional and Islamic corporate, retail, treasury, private banking, insurance, brokerage and asset management services though a number of entities, including majority owned subsidiaries and affiliates. The Bank operates through a network of 131 branches. The project is intended to support AUB in its expansion strategy in the less developed countries in the MENA region (the Region).
